description: From Middle English deserven, from Old French deservir, from Latin dēserviō, from dē- + serviō.

verbs.description: deserve (third-person singular simple present deserves, present participle deserving, simple past and past participle deserved)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To be entitled to, as a result of past actions; to be worthy to have.
examples: After playing so well, the team really deserved their win.
After what he did, he deserved to go to prison.
This argument deserves a closer examination.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To reward, to give in return for service.
(obsolete) To serve; to treat; to benefit.
examples: A man that hath / So well deserved me.
